Reviews.Title: “Very Convient to Central San Diego”
Reviews.Author: wifiwardriver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of spring break. It is only a few minutes drive from the airport, Balboa park, the Gas Lamp District and Harbor Drive. Its a short walk (about 5 blocks) to Little Italy. If you head to Little Italy for dinner, call ahead for reservations - every restaurant was on a wait both nights we walked over there. The hotel was clean, the staff friendly and the breakfast burritos from the cafe were large and tasty. We parked for free on 2nd Avenue just behind the hotel. About 3 blocks west is a great coffee shop called Pappalecco‎. We booked this hotel via a Priceline bid for $70 per night (plus $13.30 in taxes) rather than the published rate of $110 plus taxes. As mentioned in other reviews, there are homeless people living in the neighborhood, but no one ever bothered us or asked for anything.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: In the valley in the woods
Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: D P
Reviews.Content: Staff-unhelpful even management Location- awful, unless you're a fan of walking around and by homeless people and freeways Room- hot and muggy even after turning out dated ac unit on Didn't use the small pool by the freeway or the small workout room, shuttle service was terrible! Not really anything good to say about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Three night stay for business”
Reviews.Author: GregArizona
Reviews.Content: Great location 2 blocks from Little Italy section with stores, restuarants, etc. Also, can walk half a mile to Gaslight area. Rooms are small, but clean and modern. One problem, the air conditioner is old and not real effective even after the engineer came up to "fix"it. I would not stay here over the summer! The lobby and "snack bar" are very smaill. There really is no restaurant, just the snack area/resataurant which serves as their eating place. I would stay here again for the value as compared to other modern properties in the area and the convenient location near the airport and Little italy and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Night”
Reviews.Author: kevgy
Reviews.Content: Clean, functional, pleasant room in hotel reasonably well located for downtown restaurants. Pleasant staff on check in. About 10min drive from airport car rental, so not far to go after long haul flight, which is why we used it for our first night before moving on. Quick access to 163 freeway. Free wfi and wired connection in rooms. Electric shaver connect US plug only. Personally, I found it was dated and a bit drab, which is a shame because the hotel would be so much more appealing if it were brightened up a bit. Hotel restaurant appearance was particularly unappealing and could easily pass for a cramped factory canteen, so we didn’t use it. One problem with arriving late in San Diego on a weekday, is finding a meal at 9:30pm is difficult as most of the downtown restaurants said they were closing, turning away a group of 5 hungry customers. One however did serve us. At check out, there was no processing to do; the money had already been billed to one’s credit card. Overall, good for a night after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: joshbash
Reviews.Content: Some very convenient aspects. The room was comfortable, 42" flat screen TV, nice bed. I thought the lighting in the bathroom could have been better. There is a bit of hall noise when doors close. Close to highway, great shuttle service to airport, Balboa park, Sea World and areas within 3 miles. Easy walk to LIttle Italy, not a bad walk to East Village, Petco Park, Seaport, Embarcadero, Horton Plaza, etc. Try the Hob Nob Hill at 2271 First Av., for breakfast. A great find, a cool neighborhood, near Banker's Hill. Maggie, the manager and the front desk, in general, provided great service.When there was a shuttle snafu, she drove me to the airport herself and provided great conversation. The shuttle drivers were friendly and knowledgeable, it was great not to have to rent a car. The front desk called me when my high floor room was ready, before check in time. A great view from #1505. 2 free computers on the lobby for boarding passes, etc. and free easy to access wifi in the room. One negative comment, not reflecting on the hotel itself. On Some nearby streets, you will notice a homeless problem. Nothing came of it, but sad to see.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Saya_Senang
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights on a high floor at the Holiday Inn in downtown San Diego. The room was fine (except oddly the clock didn't work...no big deal, but you think a maid would notice at some point.) We did not have a problem with airport noise although the airport was in easy viewing distance. They let us check in early (thank you) and the front desk staff was very cheery and helpful. For us, visiting as first time tourists and not during real beach season, the location was perfect. We enjoyed walking around the farmers market in Little Italy, easy walking distance to the hotel. We also walked to the Midway, a farther but perfectly do-able walk. We did have a rental car (parking somewhat steep at $17/night but convenient to not find a lot) and the hotel had very convenient access to the I-5 highway (again, easily viewable from our hotel room, although we didn't have highway noise). Quick to the Mission Beach area, Balboa park, Del Mar, etc. We weren't on foot much in the area after dark, but the homeless folk we saw during the day didn't bother us. Didn't try the tiny restaurant, the gym or the pool. As long as you're not looking for a big or fancy lobby, and especially if you get a good deal via priceline, this hotel works just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay (Except for that Bathroom Door)”
Reviews.Author: kdvillines
Reviews.Content: I found the Holiday Inn to be a nice hotel that was priced accordingly. The property is located off the bay and adjacent to the I-5 Freeway. As such, it is probably not the best location for walking through San Diego, but it is not so far enough from the bay and the downtown area that walking would be completely out of the question for those with hardy legs and hearts. Our room was exceedingly clean and well kept. The bed was comfortable and encouraged a good nights sleep. The carpet was fresh and new in appearance and the flat-screened TV worked great. The free WiFi connected to my laptop without a problem and stayed connected throughout the room. Our room had a king-sized bed, work desk, dresser, armchair, and a small chair-side table. The bathroom was also clean and well maintained. However, the bathroom door was a bit of an oddity. It was made of frosted glass and actually slid open and closed along the partition wall between the living area and the bathroom. While this configuration offered privacy, there were gaps at the edges of the sliding door that did indeed offer views into the living area whilst seated on the throne. Even though the sliding door fulfilled its function, it by no means created a feeling of being in a secure vault at the heart of Fort Knox ;) Some of the photos from other reviews show this feature and for this reason alone, I would think twice about returning (but thatâ€™s just me). The hotelâ€™s location next to the freeway offers opportunities for some great views from the upper floors. We were on the sixth floor and could see parts of the bay, the freeway, and jets landing at the airport. I would recommend being higher than this if views are something you appreciate. Freeway noise was sufficiently managed by the windows. However, at the quietest of times, a sort of white noise could be heard from the freeway outside. The hotel has a small cafÃ© off of the main lobby that is not much more than a snack bar. There are much better places to eat in San Diego, but I did use the cafÃ© for getting a cup of coffee and a pastry in the mornings, which I brought back up to our room. For this reason, its presence is a plus for the establishment. Overall, this is an exceedingly nice property with the convenience of on-site food and a discouraging bathroom door.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and shuttle was a bonus”
Reviews.Author: 604bob
Reviews.Content: We reserved 2 rooms for our stay and they managed to get us into 2 adjoining rooms so we were actually able to open up the door in between and go between the 2 rooms. The rooms were quite clean and spacious and overall, the hotel appeared to be in good condition except for the washroom doors which for some reason did not close completely and left about a 1" opening?? We were checked in promptly and the staff were polite and professional. We took advantage of the 'kids eat free' offerings and had breakfast daily in their little cafe. The food quality was decent and price was acceptable after factoring in their free meals as well. The complimentary shuttle was definitely a bonus and was fairly punctual on both pickup and drop which was nice as we used it quite often to get around including to Sea World as well as the Zoo. However, they are quite strict on and will not offer pickup / dropoff beyond their stated limit (1mi I believe?). We had some concerns about the reviews which mentioned the homeless around the area and we did notice some as soon as we arrived at the hotel but they are not aggressive and will not hassle you. It is also nice being close to Little Italy which offers many great restaurant choices, as well as the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mausbaer_123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our three-week west coast roundtrip. We liked this hotel in downtown San Diego which is located in walking distance to the Gaslamp Quarter (nice for dining in the evening - especially in the nice Mexican restaurants). Parking in the hotel garage is 17 $ / day. The pool area is not too nice as it is located outside the hotel close to a main street. Overall, we were very satisfied with our choice of this downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: BWWblaxx
Reviews.Content: Much I had read about the property and its location, I think my standards were low. First of all, I must say that the whole area (and not just the hotel itself, which is by the highway) is full of homeless people and shady characters. The walk to the Gaslamp district and back can be sketchy, but I found a cab in San Diego is not expensive. The bonus? The hotel has shuttles that, when available, can take you anywhere in a 20 mile radius, this includes the airport, zoo, etc. The staff we encountered at the front desk was very hit and miss. The female staff was very pleasant to deal with. I'm afraid to say that the male staff was not up to the standards and were short and cold with their attitude. The main floor has a cafeteria, but, who wants to eat a cafeteria in a city full of interesting eateries? The rooms were very nicely decorated, modern, clean and we were very pleasantly suprised with the quality of sleep. The pool we never visited, but I noticed it was just by the highway - which didn't seem appealing. Overall, if the price is right, this is a very nice option.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average quality”
Reviews.Author: buraksan
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in November 2011 with some friends. The hotel is close to the center, walking distance to Little Italy, Gas Lamp Quartier, the shore etc. The rooms are clean but small. Our room was with "bay view" but frankly you don't see the bay or the sea much, therefore do not expect to have much of a seaview. The breakfast cafeteria is next to the reception area and is small, they include breakfast but they give you a voucher (if I'm not wrong it was worth about US$ 15/20 per person) and if you order more then you pay for the balance. Unfortunately the cafeteria kitche doesn't have a good air circulation so all the smell goes into upper floors where the rooms are. The wifi at the hotel is free, but you have to pay for the garage if you have a car (I think it was $10/12 per day). The fitness center (as they say) is in the garage and is very small, with only a couple of machines, do not expect to find a complete fitness room. Overall the hotel was average, not the best but not that bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: euexplorer
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in this hotel at the start of December. Good enough location. Balboa Park seaport village and the gaslamp are all walkable and you are basically in Little Italy. Found the staff very helpful - one guy in particular could not do enough for you. It is close to the freeway and the airport but I had no problems with noise. The only issue I had was one night the moron in the next room making loads of noise coming in drunk at 3 in the morning but the hotel can't be blamed for that. The shuttle service was very useful and they had 2 pc's in the lobby which was also of great assistance. Asked for a room with a view and they put me at the top of the hotel. With regard to negatives the pool and gym are tiny - only 1 of any type of machine - that said they were fantastic machines. Also they did not advertise the shuttle/pc services so I was there a while before I realised they were available. Overall though a very pleasant stay and would certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “OK.......But not in a great location”
Reviews.Author: moomy
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, nice enough rooms but the location was a bit dodgy, you had to walk past the homeless hang-out or walk quite a long way round to avoid it! On site Cafe was expensive but I can recommend the garage across the road who were helpful, friendly and CHEAP. As for the complimentary shuttle..........desk staff were unhelpful and the shuttle staff were rude and unwilling to take anyone anywhere - with the exception of one of the elderly drivers who was brilliant. OK if you can get it cheap otherwise I'd shop around for a more convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeDan1010
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel. The location was within walking distance of Gas Light District, and LIttle Italy. Free shuttle to the zoo and airport were also a nice extra benefit. All in all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, bit noisy, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: altrnatif
Reviews.Content: Somewhat older place but updated, a round building and strange layout, nicely appointed rooms however, not far from downtown but certainly not in downtown as was advertised (very long walk or short cab ride), great shuttle service to the airport, friendly staff. Cafe has a very limited heat & serve menu. The hotel abuts the freeway and rooms can be quite noisy. Not my hotel of choice but city was sold out elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “a nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: laurenanne84
Reviews.Content: holiday inn downtown was a great place to stay with clean rooms , nice staff the location is ok but there are hotels that are more central and of course if you would like to be near the water you would choose a bayside hotel , where there is also a holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfpen66
Reviews.Content: I have passed this hotel numerous times on Interstate 5 and always wanted to stay here due to the exterior shape. With that accomplished, I found that this hotel is a tad older. However, this hotel is very simple and clean as a previous reviewer has noted. The bathroom in the room we stayed apeared to be updated, so that was nice. Also, the bed was very comfortable and I had a great night's sleep. The room also has a big flat screen TV and the channel selection is more than most hotels offer. This hotel is right at Interstate 5, but, I heard no traffice noise inside my room. There is a small cafe just off the lobby, that has good food. We had breakfast and dinner there. The menu is simple but good. The employees give you great customer service! Every employee that served us, was very friendly and polite. Their assistance was very helpful. Since the building is round, the garage is also round. I have a mid size SUV, I found the parking spots a bit tight in some areas.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean, and Great in Value”
Reviews.Author: tjm0831
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal for this hotel under $85 through Hotwire. Once I arrived to the hotel I was surprised by the modern decor inside the room, and the fact that they offer free WI-Fi upon request. I only stayed for one night (Saturday) and it was a great one, because I Saved Money, Free Wi-Fi, Free Parking, a Clean Room/Bathroom, and Peace of Mind. Excellent Hotel and would stay here again and recommend families to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it is close to the airport...”
Reviews.Author: AXE250
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because it was near the airport and it advertised that there was an airport shuttle (but it doesn't run before 6 AM even if you try to book it the night before). I recommend that you arrange for a taxi the night before if you need to get to the airport for an early morning flight. Also the television in my room did not work (but I had an early flight so I didn't need it). There appeared to be an issue in the coffee shop/resturant, they could not take credit/debit cards. Also there was no one at the main desk when I wanted to check out at 5 AM. Now the good points, It is walking disctance to Little Italy and other interesting areas, it is close to the airport, the staff was friendly and courteous and I found the romm clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fine by us”
Reviews.Author: HereandthereBradford
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stopped here so cannot really grumble. Very handy for Little Italy (eat at Phillipo,s pizza/deli), Bilbao Park (Sandiego Zoo) and downtown San Diego.Courtesy bus will take you most places if available but just as easy to walk. Ask for top floor as you can just see the pilots in the cockpits of the planes landing at the airport (no noise though) very helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for bargain price”
Reviews.Author: tinyvella
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and found the location great easy to Little Italy, shops, down to the Harbour, we walked everywhere! Hotel room was great too, massive room, 14th floor so overloooking whole of San Diego, . Hotel is next to Highway tho but we didnt hear any noise. But if we wanted to use pool this would be an issue as wasnt v relaxing but other than that, I'd defo stay again and recommend this hotel, THEY have a free shuttle 2! x

Reviews.Title: “good location to walk to little italy”
Reviews.Author: gjrsiaga
Reviews.Content: service was great and fast when checking in. looked like building was recently remodeled. room i had was a king bed and with a semi view of the bay. room was clean and also remodeled with big restroom. great location to get onto the hwy and within walking distance of little italy. only bad thing for the light sleepers is the traffic and sirens in the rush hour times, but its a city ppl, o yea the smell of fried chicken in the elevator and lobby. whats going on with the small pillows in hotels nowadays. i would def stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value - bad location!”
Reviews.Author: Ireallyneedavacation
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying I thought I'd booked the Holiday Inn Express but got this instead. The front desk staff were friendly enough but not overly knowledgable. The parking is very limited so get there early if you want a decent space. Fortunately there must be good soundproofing because the room was quiet considering it's right next to the runway! Also, we asked for some place close by to eat - not only was the place closed that the desk clerk recommended but I felt the area around the hotel is extremely seedy & not where 2 women should have been walking at night! Free Wifi in the rooms? We stayed 2 nights & never got it working the entire time we were there! The hotel needs a BIG renovation soon!! They can't compete with the HI Expresses that offer you a room at a lower rate that includes breakfast! Not much in the way of a fitness center & the pool is nothing to write home about either!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: lola1997
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights...loved the location - easy to walk to Little Italy, Seaport and the Gas Light districts. I prefer a downtown location to the "touristy" harbour location. The shuttle ran to Balboa Park and picked up from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “No excuse for this sort of thing in the year 2011”
Reviews.Author: rwjones52
Reviews.Content: To put things in context, I am a Priority Club member with about 240,000 points. In other words, I travel a lot, and I stay in Holiday Inns a lot. Let's face it, when it comes to Holiday Inns, a bed is a bed, a desk is a desk, and a bathroom's a bathroom. The things that really vary and matter are things like location and service. The location of this Holiday Inn is pretty good for me, but it doesn't come close to making up for the absolutely terrible Internet service. Four times this week I could not get work done in my room on my laptop due to the abysmal connections. And I do mean terrible. One time I could not get a connection at all, and it took over an hour of room service calls and calls to the so-called help desk before I finally got a connection. The guy at the help desk was friendly and efficient, but it took way too long for me to finally get there. Then, three times after that I could get a network connection, but almost zero downloads. It was like watching a video try to play over a bad dial up connection. Sorry, but this will be my last stay here. These people need to realize that in the second decade of the 21st century, having a good, reliable Internet connection counts.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time here”
Reviews.Author: markiemp
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself visited San Deigo for our anniversary and stayed in the holiday inn for 11 nights. Staff were very helpful, rooms were kept very clean and we had a free paper delivered outside our room. Rooms were to a good standard,spacious and had everything we could need. The hotel offered a free shuttle service to the zoo, seaworld and to and from the airport which made life easier for us to get around. San Deigo is a fantastic place to visit, aso much to see and do and the people were very helpful and friendly to us. The hotel also had two computers with internet access which you could use as well as having a cafe for food. We did not use this as San Diego had amazing places to eat and drink. The hotel is well situated to many places such as Horton Plaza, the Gaslamp area, seaport village and the Convention centre. It is very easy to make your way around and if you did not know the staff were able to tell you, they also provide many free leaflets on things to do and see in San Diego as well as having an interactive map on the wall to find areas of interest. We had a great time here and hopefully one day would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fairly comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Maanya
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Diego with a few friends recently and since I was very keen on staying downtown this was our pick. We booked it through Kayak.com and got a pretty good deal too. Parking - we parked on the street near the hotel as we did not want to pay for the $18 valet parking charge. It worked out well for us as we walked around mostly and stayed only one night. Check in - was easy and quick. Although the lobby is kind of extremely small. Rooms - we had two queen beds and a nice choice of pillows which were labelled as soft or hard. Nice touch! It annoys me when hotels put in glass door bathrooms for the sake of style because it pretty much ensures zero privacy. I went with friends not with my partner so I did not appreciate that!! Also, while parking I noticed that the hotel overlooked an extremely busy freeway so I requested for a room that would not be on a lower floor or facing the freeway. Location - was pretty convenient; 5 min walk to the Harbor and 20 min walk to the heart of the downtown party area. The surrounding area is nothing to write home about but we felt fairly safe walking around even after dark. I maybe wouldn't go back there but its a decent bet for a budget conscious traveler who also wants a good location.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay, and Convienant Too.”
Reviews.Author: thetvler
Reviews.Content: Very nice, redecorated Holiday Inn, Met by the manager at the front desk, very helpful, and offered to move us up to a higher floor for the second day. He recommended that we park in the basement as it was easier access, and it was. Central to all of city, as the anniversary party was at the DEL Coranado, and was minutes away. Rooms were CLEAN, with nice amenities. We will stay there again when in San Diego .Parking was $17/ day, and was disclosed to us ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what it is”
Reviews.Author: anab97
Reviews.Content: GREAT: Location-pretty central to everything Modern, comfortable beds Free shuttle service to some popular attractions (though you must make a reservation or get left behind like we did.) Decent rate-though probably not worth it Somewhat friendly staff Cafeteria in hotel Heated swimming pool BEWARE: Very, very small crammed rooms and thin walls Overpriced cafeteria $17 parking per night-not included One way street next to hotel-made for interesting driving No partying policy waiver of $100-it wasn't charged and we didn't party, but it was interesting that they make you sign this Stingy with conditioner-we had to ask in order to get conditioner as our room only had shampoo and lotion No spa

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly satisfactory hotel in this price range!”
Reviews.Author: md_tide
Reviews.Content: Government travel budgets don't allow for the pricey hotels of the San Diego Harbor and Gaslamp Quarter, but while the "light industrial" location of this hotel (by the Highway 5 bypass) isn't an area I would wander at night, I found the Holiday Inn Downtown to be an simple, perfectly adequate pleasant surprise. My room with a comfortable king-size bed was spacious and very clean, with a pleasant neutral decor (granite sinks!). And there were numerous other small details that I appreciated: an attentive, pleasant and responsive staff, plenty of towels, a good heating and cooling system that I controlled, good quality soaps and lotions, free wireless that worked perfectly with my Samsung Netbook, and plumbing in good order (e.g., wasn't faced with standing in a non-draining shower as so often happens). From this hotel location you CAN walk directly down First Avenue to the harbor if you wish. Again, as another poster commented the area is a bit sketchy, not horrible but a lot of parking lots and a nearby Motel 6 - a bit gritty. But if you are just looking for a safe, clean, pleasant place to stay and have a car, I'd recommend it - the week I was there, the hotel was packed with families and business travelers. There is also a pool that I did not use but plenty of other people seemed to. They also have a little cafe on the ground floor where you can obtain breakfast etc. For the hotel type and location in a very expensive city, gets 5 stars from me for being clean, safe, and pleasant, and I would stay here again if I were in the area. Reminded me a lot of a Hampton Inn - course, you can always travel a few blocks and pay 3x more for a hotel at the San Diego Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Bad service.”
Reviews.Author: Daalmadaalvaro02791
Reviews.Content: The service was horrible. I tried asking for something and they did nothing tof try to help me. The only helpful person there was a guy that worked over night and he told us what we could do around town. The room were clean and its was a nice hotel but did not like the front desk service.

Reviews.Title: “Are you a light sleeper? If so, this might not work out ...”
Reviews.Author: trinigirlmd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the Holiday Inn Downtown from May 6 â€“ 12, 2011. This was a business trip for my DH and a leisure trip for me. On arrival we were greeted by Jose who was very pleasant and knowledgeable. When we expressed concern about noise and the location of our room, he mentioned the double pane windows and that noise would not be a problem. The noise was a problem and Iâ€™m not a light sleeper! No matter the time of day, cars were flying by and you could hear them. The hotel is also in the flight path to the airport. Take a look at my pictures. We ate at the hotelâ€™s restaurant (First Avenue Grill) a couple times for breakfast and one dinner. Food was average, but service was always great. The restaurant had all the basics (yogurt, cold cereal, juices, coffee, tea, pastry etc.) Most of the time when we ate in, we ordered from Florenciaâ€™s. An Italian restaurant that delivered. Food was tasty, arrived promptly and was hot! Our favorite restaurants were Hob Nob Hill (good food and lots of it) and Busterâ€™s at Seaport Village (definitely try the Tropical French Toast). We werenâ€™t really too fond of Edgewater Grill, which was a fave mentioned by a few TA members. If you want to go casual, we heartily recommend Yummy Buffet (off Rosecrans Avenue in the Loma Portal area). We happened upon it when I had to make a quick stop at a CVS Minute Clinic. Yummy used to be a Sizzler and was recently renovated. It was clean, staff were pleasant, and most of all, even picky eaters can find something on their large buffet. We ended up eating three lunches there during our 7 days in San Diego. In terms of activities beyond the basics (Zoo, Coronado, Embarcadero, etc), just hanging around the Seaport Village on a Saturday afternoon is cool, because you can people-watch and listen to the live music. Also, we recommend doing a Trolley Tour (early in your trip), and visiting Coronado for more than a few hours. We loved Balboa Park. Holiday Inn Pros - The staff are very helpful and pleasant - Good access off the Interstate - View out our window of the arriving planes was nice. Weâ€™ve never stayed at any hotel that was as close to an airport as the Holiday Inn. - Staff were very responsive â€“ on arrival in our room our fridge was missing in less than an hour a staff member brought it up. A bathroom issue was handled quickly and efficiently. - Free Internet that worked! Holiday Inn Cons - If youâ€™re a light sleeper the freeway noise and planes arriving could be a problem. The planes depart in the other direction from the hotel. - As someone mentioned the hallway lights shine under the room door. It was a bit annoying to have all the lights off and still have light shining under the door. - Parking is pricey and sometimes (for us, most of the time) the access card did not work. Luckily we had two key cards so if one didn't work, we used the other. Inserting several times usually worked eventually. We had a rental car, so we didn't walk around the area. There are areas close to the hotel where panhandlers frequent. As Holiday Inns go, this one was not horrible. That said our hotel selection was based on corporate policy (budget), since this was partly a business trip for one of us. If this was a true leisure trip I would likely have picked someplace different. Feel free to email me with any specific questions. I wish you safe and happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Downtown San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: lilemoevie
Reviews.Content: Overall had a very good experience with the Holiday Inn San Diego-Downtown. San Diego is a small, accessible city and there are plenty of sites to see that are within walking distance or even just a short Trolley or cab ride. The rooms had plenty of room for us (2 people), bathroom was nice, clean and updated. Shampoo/Conditioner was provided & restocked each day. Beds were very comfortable and had a selection of soft or firm pillows on each bed. Had breakfast in the hotel lobby for a reasonable price (not included) but it was delicious and the serving size was very large. The wake up call was right on time and check in and check out were very efficient! Only downside would be parking - $17 per night is a bit steep. Sat by the pool on one day and it was a nice small pool, got lots of sun and was well maintained. A gentleman from the hotel restocked towels and cleaned up the tables and chairs regularly. Suggestions of things to do: Coronado Island - stop by the Hotel Del Coronado. Also, Nice beach with street parking. USS Midway (World War II ship) Old Town - Coyote Cafe was delicious, great Margaritas! Gaslamp District - Broken Yolk Cafe breakfast was great, try their 12 egg omlette challenge! Run the Rock and Roll Marathon! Great course, lots to see

Reviews.Title: “IT was great. Helped make my Birthday enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: jhsunflour
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn. It was my birthday and the Asst General Andrew Wright was very kind in getting me a nice room with a great view. The hotel was clean and the decor fun and comfortable. Front desk staff very helpful when checking me in. Over all it was a great experience and I recommend it as a convienent place to stay if you want to do things Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Location had Pro's and Con's”
Reviews.Author: Alan056
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 12 nights and found the positives to outweigh any negative comments I have. Was lucky to get picked up by the courtesy bus at the airport as I walked towards the taxi rank, this was around 22.00hrs. Was probably there to pick up flight crew as I was only 'guest' on board, but expect an advanced phone call from myself would have resulted in them meeting me anyway. Check - in was quick and efficient, although no mention of Priority Platinum membership or upgrade offer. (Something I have noticed several times with late arrivals). First impressions of room was spacious with ample storage units, lighting and decor were on the dull and dated side, but I never book a room with the thought that i'll be living in it 24hrs a day. Bath/shower was adequate, with plentiful towels. Bed was king sized and very comfortable. Good points re location were its close proximity to Little Italy - 5 mins walk down Cedar. A further 5 mins will get you to the Maritime museum at the Embarcadero and the ferry to Coranado. 10 Mins up 1st Ave / Elm St will get you to Balboa Park, with a further 20 mins from there to the Zoo. Courtesy bus runs there daily, but I didn't use it for this location. 15 mins down 1st will get you to Gaslamp Quarter, suggest you walk to Westin Hotel and cut through courtyard to 4th Ave. No issues walking back to Hotel late at night, though would suggest again you cut through to 1st ave rather than walk up 4th or 5th as a number of homeless congregate around this area. I didn't see any bother or issues, but at that time of night it it better no to take any chances. Taxi's are plentiful and about $7/$8 dollars from mid 5th Ave. If driving Hotel is convenient for access / exit from freeway's. This does present an issue with traffic noise, which is continuous during the day and most nights. If a light sleeper would be a major problem. Also very close to flightpath, although this does stop from 10.30pm - 6.30am Snack bar area was okay, with reasonable choice and cost. There are a number of local restuarants / bars in the Little Italy area which provide a good alternative. This is also location for a trolley tour stop on the city tour. Free internet access from a couple of terminals at reception. Pool area is limited, but traffic noise prevents this from being a relaxing locale. Ear phones / plugs recommended. Gym equipment was limited, about 6 machines, but good quality., Courtesy bus to Seaworld each morning at 9.30 with 5.00pm pick up. Local public transport links are very good. Bus stop for No' 30 next block down 1st Ave, $5 day ticket will take you to Pacific / Mission / La Jolla beaches and Westfield Shopping Plaza at the end of line. Also MTS trolleys from a couple of blocks past Little Italy will get you to Old Town / Tijuana for same cost. Overall, Hotel provided best value for money when compared with other Holiday Inn sites in the city. Would have no problem booking again if in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great shuttle service but horrible front desk service”
Reviews.Author: Martlett01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because I was in town for a conference and was really disappointed with the front desk service. Because I was in town for work purposes, I was not responsible for paying for my accommodation and made that clear when I booked the reservation. When I arrived at the hotel, they asked me for a credit card authorization and when I said I didn't have it, they refused to let me check-in until they had all the documents and made me sit in their lobby for an hour and a half with all my luggage in hand. They did not offer to take my luggage nor did they check on whether all the paper work had been faxed in (I constantly had to remind them). With that said, I felt this was really horrible and extremely rude service. I have been in similar situations like this where somebody else pays for my hotel room and have never been treated so horribly. And to top it off, the staff were not aware of their own hotel policies and all the manager can say is "we've just recently changed the policy so unfortunately some of the staff are not aware of the changes." So essentially, even the hotel manager admits that his staff are incompetent! All I have to say is keep your staff in line or get rid of them and get new staff who are competent and know what they are doing. On a positive note, the shuttle service was wonderful and the drivers were extremely nice and accommodating! Will I stay at this hotel again...definitely NOT!

Reviews.Title: “Will return when in SD”
Reviews.Author: chelseagrrlx
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was reticent to stay at here at first because in my experience HI's are inconsistent at best, however, the rate offered was too good to turn down. Good choice as this HI was one of the good ones - very clean, easy check in and out, prompt cleaning, etc. Most importantly perhaps was the location, it was only 2 blocks from my sister's condo. There is plenty of street parking in the area and lots of stuff to do in walking distance. The only issue we had was with the bathroom: It has a sliding glass door with frosted glass which pours light into the room making it difficult to sleep. If you are on completely different schedules than your roommate it can be a pain. Not a big enough issue to stop us from staying here again. We will be back when we return to San Diego and have suggested the hotel to other family members who will be visiting the area in coming months.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: nicoleGoodyear_Az
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Downtown for 2 nights in April. We stayed there on a Saturday and Sunday night. The parking was plentiful. The parking fee was kind of steep but seemed to be the norm for the area. The front desk service was very friendly. There was only one person checking in ahead of us so it went very quickly. The room was nice. We booked through PriceLine and we were not given a choice of beds. They gave us 2 double beds. I would have preferred one king but didnâ€™t bother asking for it after our room was assigned. We did receive a room facing the freeway and it was rather noisy. Honestly, we are heavy sleepers so it wasnâ€™t a problem. The shuttle service was great and we scheduled pickup for Sea World. The pick up and drop off times are set for Sea World and The Zoo. They were exactly on time and it was great not having to drive there and pay a parking fee since we already paid for parking at the hotel! We also got a ride downtown to the House of Blues for dinner. We were able to walk back and it only took about 15 min or so to walk it. The area looks shady, lots of homeless but it did seem pretty safe. Very close to Little Italy. You can walk there in about 5 minutes and they have some nice restaurants, etc. Overall it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “I cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: JuliettaB
Reviews.Content: Jesus from from desck was so helpful with everything a great person :) I had good experience with this holiday inn very new remodel and clean . Its like a 5 star boutique hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Convienient Hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: coopdawg500
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here and really enjoyed it! The hotel is close to the main rail/bus terminal, has its own pool (which we took advantage of) and is close to the Port of San Diego. Rooms were great - clean, comfortable, we used the shuttle to Balboa Park and the Airport. A great hotel with friendly service and knowledgeable staff. NO issues with cleanliness or service, what a great stay it was. We walked almost everywhere from this hotel and they even helped us rent a car from a local company at a great deal. Very pleased with this hotel and would definately stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES/NOISE/STENCH!”
Reviews.Author: calinjaxnc
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving I was taken aback by the stench of grease emanating from the cheesey grill adjacent the lobby. I was even more taken aback, during the afternoon, at an intense rumbling in the building. Not knowing if there was a freight train nearby I called the front desk, only to be told the incredible noise was actually clothes driers used by houskeeping! I was utterly disgusted when I actually found ROACHES crawling around the hallways! The "free high-speed" internet was free but certainly not high speed! Not only would I NOT recommend this place to a friend, I wouldn't recommend it to my worst enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, accomdating staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: statelylady17
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took a trip to San Diego for 5 days. We read reviews on here that had us worried about our choice in hotel. Luckily for us, we had a FABULOUS experience and enjoyed this hotel very much! The staff and complimentary shuttle were great. We were pleasantly surprised by how nice everyone was and how willing they were to take us where we needed to go. We didn't have to wait for the shuttle more than 20 mins and was dropped off right at our location we requested. The shuttle ran on the weekends and even provided later hours for Friday and Saturday night. If you had to go to the airport that would take precedent over any other shuttle rides (they also provided shuttle drop offs at the zoo and Sea World). The rooms were nice and big. The bed was comfortable and easy to fall asleep in. The bathroom was spacious. We didn't eat down in the cafe they had on the lobby floor but all the food we saw other people order looked amazing! The prices for the food werenâ€™t that expensive and we would definitely eat there next time! This hotel is in a great location and not too far from downtown or the airport. We didn't walk around downtown at night but took the liberty of walking around during the day and didn't have a problem finding all the places we wanted to go. The next time we come to San Diego we are DEFINITELY staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Two fabulous nights at Holiday Inn San Diego-Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Travel44881
Reviews.Content: Spent two great nights at the Holday Inn SD-Downtown. The room was clean and service spectacular. The location is a short walk to Little Itally and not that bad of walk to either the Seaport Village or GassLight districts. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; accomodating staff and lovely rooms.”
Reviews.Author: DorisMontreal
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is a bit away from Seaport Village, we were able to walk it. Hotel is in a more residential neighbourhood. There is a small restaurant, almost cafteria style off lobby which was very convenient. Walk up the hill a few blocks to the Hob Nob Hill..great breakfast. The rooms in the hotel seem newly furnished...our bed was VERY comfortable and the room was modern and clean. The Friont Desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, No big complaints”
Reviews.Author: Pete4vol
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Holiday Inn Downtown to attend a conference at the San Diego Conference Center. It was about a 15 minute walk from the hotel, probably close to a mile away. It didn't bother me much but for many I would guess this is too far away. It is close to Little Italy but still a couple blocks away. There are no grounds to speak of, a very small swimming pool and a small gym. The gym didn't have much in the way of A/C. For myself, being here for work I was not disappointed but for someone on vacation this is not probably the best hotel. Overall, the room was a good size, the lobby was a little small but sufficient. The rooms were clean. My experience with the service was very good, although when I left in the morning room service dishes for another room had been left in the hall and had not yet been picked up when I returned around 4. I was able to ask for recommendations for restaurants and directions and people seemed to have good ideas and were happy to help. Not a bad place to stay on business but a San Diego vacation would be better served elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but not close enough to everything”
Reviews.Author: ebstar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great stay if you would like an amazing room and great amenities but you are just that bit too far away from everything. The hotel itself is clean and well catered for with a nice modern style. The pool though is very small and is surrounded by a wall but a hill is on the other side, so people in the cars and walking can peer in. The room is also very clean and has really nice furniture and linen. Features include a flat screen TV and great cable channels, ample desk and space to put your things. The bathroom is very spacious and luxurious with every amenity you need. Unfortunantly this is a great hotel but a bit of a dodgy location. Set right next to an overpass and quite a few homeless in the area. The other shame was that it really wasn't walking distance to anything that you go to San Diego to see. Next time I would definitely stay next to the bay or close to the gas lamp district. San Diego is an incredible city and you really need to be in it rather than trying to find ways to get yourself there! During the day the hotel staff can take you to attractions like the San Diego Zoo and down to the Bayside area but you have to find your way back. This service is also only available if someone is free to take you. We really loved the hotel but wouldn't stay there again due to the location. It's a bit of a shame really.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lisadjcr
Reviews.Content: I recently went to San Diego to meet up with my spouse who is in the Canadian Navy. We stayed at the Holiday Inn on First Ave. It was great. We had the dream and drive package which included a rental car, and free parking. We noticed when we came back to the room later the day of check in that there was a stain on the quilt. My spouse called down and told them. The manager Keith came up personally and re-made our bed. He was wonderfully efficient, and even though bed-making was not his job, he did great, and we all had a really good laugh! Keith was one of the reasons we would come back again. San Diego is a frequent stop for the Canadian Navy, and I know we will be back, and we will be asking for Keith when we get there. Thank you Keith for the good times! Who new that bed making could be so much fun:) Doug and Lisa, Victoria, BC

Reviews.Title: “You Spin Me Round Like a Record...And Not Necessarily in a Good Way”
Reviews.Author: shoeluv
Reviews.Content: Pros: The lobby and rooms have all undergone a recent renovation to update amenities. Complimentary shuttle service that can take you to the top San Diego area destinations. The staff was very nice. Cons: The parking facility is atrocious at best with spaces designed primarily for compact or subcompact cars. The hotel's location, while relatively close to downtown San Diego, is surrounded by a major freeway and airport. As such, noise level has a tendency to be high. Very limited (and unhealthy) dining options on the property. The Holiday Inn San Diego Downtown is one of those antique circular properties that are leftover from the 50's. I've always wondered what a stay in one of these hotels would be like, and now I know. Mostly, it is cramped, and confusing to maneuver. On the bright side, this Holiday Inn has gone through a complete remodel to modernize its look and amenities. What that means is that rooms are clean, functional and have everything you'd look for in a comfortable stay. Depending on your location in the hotel, your room could have a gorgeous view of the beaches or the dizzying interchange of the I-5 freeway. I had the latter, which meant that I also had the pleasure of car/truck noises and airplane take-offs to lull me to sleep (the hotel is adjacent to the airport). Also on the plus side, the complimentary shuttle service takes you to all the downtown hot spots, as well as the San Diego Zoo and Sea World. That is a very nice service, and might convince you to forego a rental car. Now, the hotel has a restaurant on the lobby level, but it is very off-putting. In fact, the first thing you smell upon entering the lobby is the odor of fried food and old oil. That alone makes one think that ordering from the little cafe could clog your arteries in less than a heartbeat. I did, indeed, eat there and while the service was very cheery, the food was woeful. This property also has a laundry room, exercise room and a pool. However, they were so difficult to find in the labyrinthine parking structure, that you might throw in the towel before ever arriving to them. Speaking of the parking structure, this is truly one of the worst I've ever encountered. The secured gates that prevent outsiders from entering did not work the entire time I was there, so you'd have to call the help line and the gate would go up automatically. So much for the security piece. Additionally, because the property is circular, spaces are odd shaped and very narrow. I saw cars that had 2 inches between them. Definitely not an ideal location to park, and if you do, just know you might leave with a few extra dents on your car. Overall, this hotel is average, and when compared to other Holiday Inns in the area, is probably slightly lower in value for the price. For better value nearby in a comparable price range, you might consider the Holiday Inn Express San Diego Downtown, which offers a free breakfast and slightly lower room rate.

Reviews.Title: “The FREE shuttle was NICE!”
Reviews.Author: WhoELS
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and what we expected for a Holiday Inn. What we really appreciated was the shuttle service! We were picked up at the airport with a very short wait (shorter than expected!) and they also dropped us off and picked us up from the San Diego Zoo! A VERY nice service all for FREE! The Hotel also has free wifi which is nice. When returning to San Diego I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lulu406
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend. Rooms were very clean & comfortable. Only complaint is that the wifi was not reliable - it was down almost the whole time we were there. On-site restaurant was convenient but expensive(as with most hotel restaurants). Parking was free. Also, if there shuttle service isn't busy with airport runs, they will give you a ride to where you need to go (the gaslamp district, pier, etc.). 10 min walk away from Little Italy. 15/20 min walk to gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with nice view!”
Reviews.Author: DerickG25
Reviews.Content: Nice 2 1/2 star hotel in San Diego. Customer Service was slow in to responding to emails but came through with an A+, free parking, penthouse level with view. In a strange area not too close to anything. 25 min walk to destinations of interest. Overall a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here in a pinch, but there are much better options close by”
Reviews.Author: aaebert67
Reviews.Content: Ok, the good first: Took about 5 minutes to get me checked in and into my room. Nice view of the water, ships on the water, etc. Cute snack bar in lobby with pre-made sandwiches, drinks, breakfast, etc. Free, no-hassle internet Free shuttle. Shuttle picked up relatively promptly (waited 20 minutes). When leaving hotel, shuttle wasn't available and several of us were waiting, so manager called us a cab and paid for it for us. Good sized, flat screen tv. And the bad: Beds were not very comfortable, blankets were old and clearly well-used ( not something that you want touching your face), king bed only had two tiny pillows. Bathroom did not have a real door- it had sliding door with frosted glass windows. Windows did not open at all. Walls and door are pretty thin- could hear everything that went on in the hallway. I stayed here after staying at the Doubletree, and I was so disappointed. I got an ok deal- about $100 a night. Compared to the Doubletree, which is literally a 3 minute walk across the street, this hotel seemed shabby, outdated, and uncomfortable. Price is ok, experience is ok, but I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little above average experience, probably would stay again if at same reduced nightly rate”
Reviews.Author: daflipremix
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel late august-early september for a pleasure venture in San Diego. From the outside, the hotel is nicely located near the I-5 freeway for easy access, recently renovated, and property is well-kept. Easy arrival, the front desk even let us do an early check-in at 1000. There are two elevators that can get pretty busy at peak times, so we used the nearby stairs. Placed at the 6th floor 2 doubles room facing the back side of the hotel, outside noise was barely heard during the night. The beds were comfortable and clean, HDTV with HD channels a plus, desk with nightstand and chair, free wifi, coffeemaker, and very clean bathrooms are the highlights of the room. Housekeeping does a great job cleaning the rooms, and the condition of the furnishings are relatively new. Now for the downsides of the room, where there was no provided refrigerator (50 dollars/night to rent one) for perishable food, no dvd player, and the A/C unit can be quite loud when working, making sleep sometimes difficult. However, the room itself I feel is a good value for how much i paid (60/night through priceline). The onsite restaurant is small, very pricey, and we avoided eating there and went to other nearby affordable food places for meals. The food is nothing special and quite mediocre in taste. Parking is steep here which is 16/night, and spaces are narrower than average, making bigger size vehicles a bit difficult to park. The swimming pool is small and the fitness room consists of dumbbells, 1 treadmill, stairclimber, and elliptical. I used it every morning before venturing out and the equipment worked out just fine. The provided shuttle service only goes to Seaworld and San Diego Zoo for the attractions and airport and local downtown places based on availability of the driver. I didnt use this service because I had a rental car and the return flight was before 6am, which was when the shuttle service starts everyday. Laundry is at the ground level and there are only 2 washers and dryers each. Overall, polite employees and a clean room made this stay rewarding. I would stay here again if I could pay the same rate. If not, I would probably look elsewhere the next time I stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LBOskiBear
Reviews.Content: This is definitely an older property that has been refurbished to the current Holiday Inn look. Nothing special, while the front desk acknowledged Priority Club membership at check-in, no upgrade was offered. The air conditioner is a wall unit, so it's either on or off, no temperature thermostat to set. This means it's loud and always blowing if you want any air circulation.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy and worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Travellersato
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Very clean and modern bathroom. Very very friendly staff.the staff was very quick at helping you with anything. The only complaint was the fact that I was on the 14th floor and there's only 2 elevators so it took a while to get down. Also it was $16 for parking a night, and threes isn't much that you can walk to. But the stay was great. Great prices and pretty spacious room. I would go back again. But only if I had a car.

Reviews.Title: “not a holiday hotel”
Reviews.Author: uglybug2
Reviews.Content: booked for 11 nights , boring business hotel in seedy part of town given a small double room overlooking the very noisy freeway ,small cafe with avery limited menu and staff who coulnt cope with the sheer volume of comic com guests wanting a breakfast! food and drinks always warm never hot,no bar no garden or terrace to relax in,a small concrete pool area,and god help you if you smoked,set aside in fly infested tiny area located by the parking area was x4 ratten seats to sit looking at the garage doors constantly swing open and shut,as for the free minibus ,we waited to be taken into gaslamp for comicon was told by driver he would leave on half hour ,got in with others drove up to the slip road of freeway only to be told that he wasnt going our way but going to airport we all had to get off and walk back to hotel no apology from surly rude driver or from reception,couldnt wait to leave this hotel ,my advice dont go there ever.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay while in SD for Comic Con”
Reviews.Author: hosaka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my third Comic Con. My first year I stayed at the Marriott attached to the convention center. Last year and this year I stayed at the Holiday Inn. This Holiday Inn is an easy, quick cab ride to the convention center (though I have walked it when the weather is nice) but away from the immediate craziness of the convention. Stayed in a top floor room which was nice, newly remodeled, and had a great view. Iron, ironing board, cable (including HD channels), large bathroom, generous working desk. Dining is available downstairs, though it's not really a restaurant. Can get busy between 8-9 am, so eat early before heading out or plan for a little extra time at breakfast. The room I stayed in was big, and it was easy to decompress there after a day at the con and a night out. Very quiet rooms (maybe due to the circular shape of the building and the circular halls?). Hotel is literally next to the 5 exit, so access is easy from the freeway. No business center, but there are 2 computers and a printer in the lobby (not free Internet access for those machines, though, FYI). For a minimum of fuss with a fantastic value for your dollar, it's a great (and much less expensive) alternative to the other hotels closer to the convention.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, good location and a good value. Enjoy your stay, we did.”
Reviews.Author: petec4591
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel several times over the years and have always been satisfied. (I travel quite a bit.) We were here on a Friday, left for another location and then returned for a long weekend the next Thursday. They kept extra luggage for us without an issue. Their van driver (Bob) was pleasant and helpful. Overall we thought it was a good hotel at a very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kaekae66
Reviews.Content: Everything exceeded my expectations at this hotel. I would recommend this for its quality and value.

Reviews.Title: “I was so impressed with the quality of service and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: cmkMinnesota
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with the quality of service and accommodations during my recent stay. It started with being able to check into our room at 10:00 am. The room was very nice, clean and modern and we had a beautiful view of the bay. We received exceptional help with a reservation problem (one night of our stay had been booked at another hotel due to unavailability) and the staff was able to accommodate basically three reservations so that we could stay uninterruped at this hotel in the same room. We were also able to use the courtesy hotel van several times which was great. The staff was always friendly, helpful and professional. Only possible negative comment is the hotel restaurant is a grill/cafe style with average food.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and loved San Diego”
Reviews.Author: codycharles
Reviews.Content: I Stayed here for three nights prior to a cruise and loved it. Easy to walk to everywhere and felt very safe. Although I booked with Priceline I was upgraded to a harbour view room by giving my priority club information. Hotel was spotless and very well maintained. All the staff were extremely friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated, at the foot of the freeway - access to everything..”
Reviews.Author: Ryguy7
Reviews.Content: It seems the Holiday Inn brand is working towards updating itself. I know that when I think of the chain, it often comes with mixed reviews - which is precisely how I thought this stay was going to be. I'm happy to say I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. I'd drive by it a few times the last time I was in San Diego. Looking at it from the freeway it appeared a bit old and had the potential to have lots of traffic noise filter into the rooms. I was impressed to see that when we checked-in, we found ourselves in a newly renovated property with good sealing on the windows. We found this hotel on Priceline yet were given a high floor room that faced downtown. I am always happy when Priceline guests are treated the same as others - or at least, I got the feeling we were. The front desk employees were courteous and efficient, and I really enjoyed both the unique restaurant recommendations we got when we asked for help for somewhere to eat. The room itself was done up nicely - and slightly larger than normal. It was set up appropriately given the unusual circular shape of the building. Our room contained two double beds that were very comfortable, as well as the usual desk and TV unit. The one thing I did not like at all about the room was the bathroom - it had a sliding door instead of a normal one and allowed almost no privacy. My friend and I were not fond of this in the slightest. Other than that - the room was great. Location wise - this hotel is literally at the foot of the entrance to the 5 Freeway (both North and South entrances). I was concerned about noise but we never got any humming from the highway. This location is great to get anywhere in the city, but a little inconvenient if you are going downtown because you have to circle up past the freeway. Not a big deal, but you cannot turn right to go to the center of the city. The core is also walkable - but places such as the Gaslamp Quarter are not close by (maybe 20 minutes). In terms of amenities - there is free wireless in the rooms which is always greatly appreciated. We were charged $15.00 a night for parking which was a bit less than the last hotel I stayed at in San Diego. There is a pool (no jacuzzi) on the ground floor but to be honest, the cosmetic appearance of the pool area left little to be desired. There is also a small restaurant in the lobby which we didn't sample. Overall, I thought the value of this hotel was high when it came to the new rooms and items such as free internet. It'd be nice if the bathroom door was a regular locking door, and not a sliding piece of clouded glass. The location at the freeways was perfect for our trips to Coronado and MIssion Beach. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn gone wild”
Reviews.Author: jbrown1070
Reviews.Content: To start off on this review. I ended up renting a room the same weekend as prom. I think this will give anyone an idea of the following paragraphs. I stayed in this holiday inn during May from a wed through sunday. I was pleased with the staff, room, house cleaners and location upto saturday night. We just arrived back from a wedding on Saturday at 10:00pm and had to leave at 4am the next morning to make a 6am flight. Saturday was the same night as prom for H.S. in san diego. The first problem was parking because all of the spots were taken or cars that were parked in two spots. I had to park on the street behind the hotel. Normally, This is not an issue but we have to pay $15 per day for parking, I would expect to find parking If I am paying. My wife and I arrived in our bedroom and hit the bed immediately to get some sleep. All night we heard banging, furniture moving and loud talking upstairs. I was planning to go to the front desk around 11:30 but was intercepted by another guest who was doing the same thing. I decided to head back to bed and hope everything would stop. Unfortunately, the noise persisted. We left our room around 4am and headed downstairs to check out. The elevator had empty beer cans, empty plates of food and some vomit on the floor. This was not a site my wife or I appreciated. We mentioned the issues with the girl at the front desk. She said she dealt with the issues all night and apologized for the noise. I, unfortunately, forgot to mention the parking issue with the girl at the front desk and still was charged the $15 fee for parking. This was the first time that I used the holidy Inn for San Diego. I am waiting on a call back from the manager and will decide from there wheather I will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and Free Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: lajababu
Reviews.Content: I liked so many things about this hotel. First of all the shuttle is complementry and they can ride you to airport or downtown. Second the rooms are large with comfy bed. Third the internet was free. And fourth, the front desk staff was very helpful and gave us complimentry water bottle and cookies. It was an oustanding value for the price I paid for this hotel. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but lack of services”
Reviews.Author: drehutch
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at this hotel it was clean and updated we were on the 10th floor and it was very quite, my only complant was that I had to call on two diffrent days to have the maids come and clean the room! and on the second day I called down for more towels and had to wait over 40mins, untill I called back down and the front desk apologized for the delay and the towels arrived within 5 mins. but again great for the price and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Morgman
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for a weeklong stay here via Priceline, but would stay here again regardless. The location was good. We walked to the Gaslamp district, and though it was a walk, it wasn't overly far, maybe 8-10 blocks. Even though Interstate 5 was right outside, we could rarely hear it, and the planes landing at the nearby airport were a non-issue. We didn't have any problems during our stay. The food at the on-site restaurant was way better than we expected. The breakfasts were especially good. At $5, I had the blueberry pancakes(3 large ones) almost every day. Lasted me until we would have an early dinner. The one complaint I would have about this hotel was that it charged $6 for each 15 min. of internet use in the lobby(but printing out boarding passes was free). Also, a word of warning. When we first got to the hotel we were tired and hungry. Thinking the lobby restaurant was closed, we ordered the first thing we saw, which was a flier slipped under our door for Tahiti(and now possibly Abelina) Pizza. It took two hours to get there, was cold and terrible. Do not order from these places. I was going to write a seperate review, but these palces don't show up in any searches. As far as the on-sire restaurant goes, when you are in the lobby it looks like it is closed because of the way the wall is laid out, but it is open 'til 10 p.m. and takes last orders at 9:30. If you do not want to venture out, by all means eat here. They also have beer and a limited liquor selection. There is also Mixon Liquor and Deli one block south of the hotel on 1st Ave. if you want to make your own drinks, and the gas station across the street also sells beer and liquor.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at a Holiday Inn again.”
Reviews.Author: Phil567
Reviews.Content: I have never felt the need to post a negative comment related to a hotel stay until now. The rooms are too small for more than one person, and the location is right next to the noisy I-5 freeway. We were enticed to stay at this hotel due to the "stimulus" savings package that was advertised. The food coupons we were given on check-in turned out to be invalid, so we had to wait for an hour until the staff fumbled and stumbled to find the correct food coupons to give us. I called the hotel before hand to make sure they had a heated swimming pool but found out later that the pool wasn't heated. The worst part of my 3 night stay was the hotel restaurant. The food they had on hand was good, but most menu items weren't available. I haven't stayed at a Holiday Inn in years, and now I remember why.

Reviews.Title: “Nice older hotel- a liitle out of the way from downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Mindy53
Reviews.Content: Clean, large room, friendly staff. Small restaurant attached with great burgers.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy on the north side.”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and comfortable-- I have no complaints in that department. But on the north side (where I facing) there *was* a bit of noise. My room's window looked straight up the I-5. During rush hour, the noise turned int a roar. In addition, planes landing at San Diego International Airport passed right in front of my 15th floor window. I chatted with many return visitors, so I imagine it's something you get used to. But next visit, I'll ask for a room on the south side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location; Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: Yanwan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a couple of friends for just 1 night from 13- 14 Nov 2009. Upon arriving at the hotel, we had to load our own bags onto the bell carts and bring them in ourselves. The room was ready at 10am which was a bonus. It was an extremely tiny room with 2 double beds and with 3 of us and 3 big luggage, we pratically had nowhere to walk. The room however was upgraded and quite nice. The hotel had not many facilities and just a cafe style F&B outlet. Location wise, we did not explore much of downtown but the taxi ride to the San Diego Zoo was fairly short. Service at this property was bad. The receptionist who checked us in happened to be the duty manager and she seemed annoyed and impatient with my questions. Furthermore, like I mentioned earlier, we had to roll in our own bell cart and that cart actually sat outside our room for the entire day! All in all, a nice quick stay for travlers on a budget looking for some form of comfort and are not planning on staying in the room for long.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, but friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Makenna09
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. We were given a room on the 6th floor. The room was pretty cramped, they just fit in 2 double beds, and small sitting desk with the TV and phone on it, and a sitting chair under a lamp. The bathroom, was nice with a marble top counter, toilet and shower! The staff here i found were nice and more than happy to answer any questions and help us out. The hotel runs a free shuttle service to the San Diego Zoo, Seaworld and the airport. We took full advantage of this and used these services to all attractions mentioned above. The drivers were nice and made sure they explained when and where pick up times were. (Although they were late on both occasions, but I think I can hopefully put it down to traffic). I didn't feel very safe walking the streets of San Diego, but once I was back in the hotel, I felt a little more at ease. This hotel was very basic, but clean and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: fagana
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there and I was very unhappy. I booked through priceline and when I checked in I was given a room on the 4th floor. I went to bed early (9:30 pm) and as I was dozing off, I noticed something crawling on the wall...it was a cockroach! I killed it and called front desk; they told me they were full but we're going to look into transferring me hotel. 45 min later I had not heard anything and by then I was so tired (having been up for almost 24h travelling). I called again and they said they found a room on the 12th floor that they were cleaning for me. I went about 20 min later and the room was a downgrade (2 double beds instead of a king I had booked and smaller) and the toilet seat was dirty! Not a very good clean-up job even if it was rushed given the circumstances. I slept poorly that night and got up at 6 am to speak with the manager regarding a possible transfer to another hotel. She told me that they have no cockroaches and the one I saw must have come from a guest's luggage !!??!! [---] She told me I could not be transferred because I had booked with priceline and the hotel would not be reimbursed! She told me she could book me another hotel if I payed for it out of my own pocket! So basically, they did not want to take a loss for something that is their fault but I should instead! What great customer service! She offered me a room upgrade and two $10 vouchers for breakfast, as if I would eat at the likely source of infestation! She never called priceline in order to sort things out; I called but it was impossible to speak to anyone (you have to email your problem and they will get back to you). Finally, I accepted the room upgrade since by then it was 8 am and I had to go to my meeting. Two days later priceline got in touch with me and dealt with the regular manager; he offered me the possibility of early check-out and being reimbursed for the 2 nights I would not be staying with them I refused because by then , my stay was 2/3 over and it was unlikely I would find a hotel with a conference in town. They did give me free parking for 3 nights. Overall, a very bad experience that ruined my stay. I had to waste so much time dealing with this stupid issue during a business trip and I feel the 'extras' that were thrown my way were insufficient. I have a phobia about cockroaches and had to constantly worry they would get in my stuff and I might bring some home; I would have to put all my things in my suitcase when I left the room. Needless to say, I will never stay there again or deal with priceline since their attitude is that if you get a deal you are stuck with it, no matter what! Another reason for frustration was that a lot of the staff at the front desk (including the female manager) are not fluent in english and did not understand everything I told them. The general manager was fluent and it made it easier dealing with him at least but he was there only on weekdays. So to wrap up: AVOID at all costs! Wi-fi was very spotty on the 16th floor and business center is in the lobby with loud music blaring. 20-25 min walk from convention center

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sos100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for CTIA Conference in San Diego. Good basic hotel. Free wireless, a kitchen that's not bad (they do a decent breakfast), and friendly and helpful staff. It's basic, and is being done - up. I liked it. Especially the price - which was cheap! 20 minute walk to the conference centre (and also Gaslamp area).

Reviews.Title: “Close to Gaslamp, Friendly, Quality & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: acota
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value and a very nicely updated Holiday Inn. We stayed 2 nights for a concert/ anniversary weekend. The room was on the 11th floor and we could see the bay and all the old ships. You can see the airport, but not hear the airport at all (or the nearby freeway) The rooms are modern, nicely decorated, comfy and roomy. The front desk was really helpful with giving us directions around town. This hotel is a short walk to the train station, little italy, the cruise ship terminals, trolly stations & gaslamp district.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: CenlaTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Downtown San Diego during our recent visit to San Diego. We were only staying 3 nights, and were working with a pretty tight budget, so we went to Hotwire to book our hotel. I had done quite a bit of research and felt pretty confident that the hotel we were selecting would turn out to be this Holiday Inn. Because I had already checked out the location, reviews, services, etc, I was OK with this choice. I did not have any overblown expectations about this being a 5 star resort. I expected a clean, safe, comfortable, quality hotel with a courteous staff. The hotel met all my expectations. The room was very clean, and well appointed with an HDTV and comfortable beds. The bathroom was very spacious with a large countertop. We did not have any problems with noise, and our A/C worked just fine. Our primary view was of downtown, and if you looked to the right you could see the harbor. The staff was always courteous and helpful. We took advantage of the shuttle service from the airport, and the shuttle driver offered to take us/pick us up from various tourist points as long as we make arraingements in time for him to work that into his airport schedule. We had the shuttle pick us up from the harbor area one afternoon, and then they provided round trip service for our Hornblower dinner cruise one night. It was very nice to not have to call and wait for a taxi. We did not eat at the cafe in the restaurant. We did not have a rental car, so we did not have to worry about/pay for parking. (I noticed a lot of compaints about parking charges. $16/nt? Get over it! Come to New Orleans and pay $30-$40/nt and then talk to me about parking! :) ) The only drawback to the hotel (for us, anyway) was the location. It would have been better for us to be a few blocks closer to the harbor for the majority of the activities we had planned. But, that was not a major issue. If we plan a return trip to the area, we may not stay here solely for this reason. But, if we need to go with a less expensive hotel option again, we will surely consider the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: secretconsumer
Reviews.Content: Really nice granite countertops in the bathroom; love the setup in there. Roomy, spacious, and relaxing. Within walking distance of the Gaslamp district and Balboa Park. Is also literally next door to I-5 (yet there's not a lot of noise). Not fond of the hidden fee of around $2.30 for "marketing research." Don't get the parking permit for $14. There's a parking lot just down the street for $6 all day.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Remembers the Meaning of Customer Service! Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: katefromthelake
